body_html:
@chenzhekl Thank you!!
But, I think the expression is non-trivial.
Numpy supports both expressions:

>>> numpy.zeros(5)
array([ 0.,  0.,  0.,  0.,  0.])
>>> x = numpy.zeros(5)
>>> x[[0, 3]]
array([ 0.,  0.])
>>> x[[0, 3], ]
array([ 0.,  0.])

Is there any reason not to support the simple expression such as x[[0, 3]]?

>>> x[[0, 3]]

>>> x[[0, 3], ]

Is there any reason not to support the simple expression such as x[[0, 3]]?
body:
@chenzhekl Thank you!!
But, I think the expression is non-trivial.
Numpy supports both expressions:

    >>> numpy.zeros(5)
    array([ 0.,  0.,  0.,  0.,  0.])
    >>> x = numpy.zeros(5)
    >>> x[[0, 3]]
    array([ 0.,  0.])
    >>> x[[0, 3], ]
    array([ 0.,  0.])

Is there any reason not to support the simple expression such as x[[0, 3]]?
